issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Hello, I am preparing an update of the Debian package to version 3.3.1, but I can not use the resulting euca2ools commands on the EC2, while if I revert to version 3.1.0 it works well (which means that my configuration file is probably not the problem). Here is an example with euca-describe-volumes. I have masked parts of the output that contain my identifiers. 2016-10-21 21:45:54,233 DEBUG DescribeVolumes parsed arguments: {'filters': None, 'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'region': None, 'VolumeId': [], 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None} 2016-10-21 21:45:54,233 INFO Config finding global option default-region 2016-10-21 21:45:54,233 INFO Config found default-region = test 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config set region to test 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config finding region option user 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 DEBUG Config section test 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config found test::user = 'charles' 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config set user to charles 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config finding region option ec2-url 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 DEBUG Config section test 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config found test::ec2-url = 'https://ec2.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/' 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config finding region option name 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 DEBUG Config section test 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config found test::name = 'test' 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config finding global option max-retries 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config novalue for max-retries 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config finding global option timeout 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config novalue for timeout 2016-10-21 21:45:54,234 INFO Config finding region option verify-ssl 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 DEBUG Config section test 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 DEBUG Config section * 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 INFO Config novalue for verify-ssl 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 INFO Config finding user option key-id 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 DEBUG Config section charles 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 INFO Config found charles::key-id = 'xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx' 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 INFO Config finding user option secret-key 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 DEBUG Config section charles 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 INFO Config found charles::secret-key = 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 DEBUG HmacV4Auth using auth info from configuration 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 INFO DescribeVolumes parameters: {'Action': 'DescribeVolumes', 'Version': '2014-06-15'} 2016-10-21 21:45:54,235 DEBUG DescribeVolumes sending flattened parameters as form data 2016-10-21 21:45:54,237 INFO EC2 sending request (attempt 1 of 3) 2016-10-21 21:45:54,240 DEBUG HmacV4Auth payload hash: 6e5bd0863fdd60d91323571ae4c27e56d19f259a922271e1a14ee6e141334072 2016-10-21 21:45:54,240 DEBUG HmacV4Auth scope: 20161021/test/ec2/aws4_request 2016-10-21 21:45:54,240 DEBUG HmacV4Auth canonical URI: 'content-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded', 'host:ec2.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com', 'x-amz-content-sha256:6e5bd0863fdd60d91323571ae4c27e56d19f259a922271e1a14ee6e141334072', 'x-amz-date:20161021T124554Z'] 2016-10-21 21:45:54,240 DEBUG HmacV4Auth signed headers: accept;accept-encoding;content-length;content-type;host;x-amz-content-sha256;x-amz-date 2016-10-21 21:45:54,240 euca2ools/3.3.1-89-gc039d1f (CPython 2.7.9; Linux 4.6.0-0.bpo.1-amd64; x86_64) requestbuilder/devel requests/2.11.1 2016-10-21 21:45:54,241 DEBUG EC2 request header: X-Amz-Content-SHA256: 6e5bd0863fdd60d91323571ae4c27e56d19f259a922271e1a14ee6e141334072 2016-10-21 21:45:54,241 DEBUG EC2 request header: X-Amz-Date: 20161021T124554Z 2016-10-21 21:45:54,241 DEBUG EC2 request data: Action: DescribeVolumes 2016-10-21 21:45:54,241 DEBUG EC2 request data: Version: 2014-06-15 2016-10-21 21:45:54,568 DEBUG EC2 response time: 0.327 seconds 2016-10-21 21:45:54,569 ERROR EC2 response status: 401 2016-10-21 21:45:54,569 DEBUG EC2 response header: Date: Fri, 21 Oct 2016 12:45:53 GMT 2016-10-21 21:45:54,569 DEBUG EC2 response header: Server: AmazonEC2 2016-10-21 21:45:54,569 DEBUG EC2 response header: Transfer-Encoding: chunked 2016-10-21 21:45:54,573 DEBUG DescribeVolumes -- response content -- AuthFailureAWS was not able to validate the provided access credentials597a6f17-f1b7-4b97-b3bd-cc38b6182087 2016-10-21 21:45:54,573 DEBUG DescribeVolumes -- end of response content -- 2016-10-21 21:45:54,573 INFO DescribeVolumes result: failure euca-describe-volumes: error (AuthFailure): AWS was not able to validate the provided access credentials Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/euca-describe-volumes", line 6, in euca2ools.commands.ec2.describevolumes.DescribeVolumes.run() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 308, in run cmd.handle_cli_exception(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 305, in run result = cmd.main() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 210, in main response = self.send() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 281, in send return BaseRequest.send(self) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 176, in send return self.handle_server_error(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 163, in send auth=self.auth) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 225, in send_request self.handle_http_error(response) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/euca2ools/commands/ec2/__init__.py", line 64, in handle_http_error raise AWSError(response) euca2ools.exceptions.AWSError: (401, 'Unauthorized', 'AuthFailure', 'AWS was not able to validate the provided access credentials') I am using python-requestbuilder version 0.5.2. Please let me know if you would like more information. Cheers, -- Charles
fields.summary: Error with the EC2: AWS was not able to validate the provided access credentials

comments.body:
This line is indicative:

{code}2016-10-21 21:45:54,240 DEBUG HmacV4Auth scope: 20161021/test/ec2/aws4_request{code}

Euca2ools 3.3 uses signature version 4, which is sensitive to the region's name.  If you don't supply a {{name}} option in the region section in your configuration file it will use the name of the section.  Try either renaming the section to {{ap-northeast-1}} or adding {{name = ap-northeast-1}} to that section.

FWIW, the euca2ools source tree includes configuration and certificates for AWS that work out of the box when they're copied to /etc/euca2ools and /usr/share/euca2ools/certs.  Those are probably worth packaging.  [Here's|http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/euca2ools.git/tree/euca2ools.spec?id=8acf0351c3c38df84f92b250537d5564bf7b82a1#n121] the code where we do that for Fedora.

Thanks a lot, renaming solved the problem.

In the Debian package, we distribute the certificates in:

/usr/share/euca2ools/certs/cert-ec2.pem
/usr/share/euca2ools/certs/cert-ec2-cn-north-1.pem
/usr/share/euca2ools/certs/cert-ec2-gov.pem

And the configuration files in:

/etc/euca2ools/euca2ools.ini
/etc/euca2ools/conf.d/aws.ini
/etc/euca2ools/conf.d/localhost.ini
/etc/euca2ools/bundle-vol/excludes
/etc/euca2ools/bundle-vol/fstab
